sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the "Foreign Bank
Definitions. As used in this Act, unless the context requires
No person, copartnership, association, corporation or other entity
sections.text:
shall establish or maintain a representative office in this State on behalf
of one or more foreign banks unless the foreign bank to be represented has
obtained a license from the Commissioner.

sections.heading: (a)  Each foreign bank which is licensed to establish and maintain
sections.text:
a representative office shall make, keep, and preserve at such office or
at such other place as determined by the Commissioner, such books, accounts,
and other records relating to the business of such office as the Commissioner
may require.

sections.heading: Reliance on Commissioner.
sections.text:
No foreign bank or other person shall
be liable under this Act for any act done or omitted in good faith in
conformity with any rule, interpretation, or opinion issued by the
Commissioner of Banks and Real Estate, notwithstanding that after the act or
omission has occurred, the rule, opinion, or interpretation upon
which reliance is placed is amended, rescinded, or determined by judicial or
other authority to be invalid for any reason.

sections.heading: Non-English language transactions.
sections.text:
A foreign bank
representative office may conduct
transactions in a language other than English through an employee or agent
acting as interpreter or through an interpreter provided by the customer.

sections.heading: Powers of the Commissioner.
sections.text:
The Commissioner shall have
under this Act all of the powers granted to him under the Illinois Banking
Act, including the authority to impose a reasonable charge to recover the
cost of an examination conducted by the Commissioner,
to the extent necessary to enable the Commissioner to supervise the
representative office of a foreign bank holding a license.
